result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius Thorny Mathes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Demetrius Thorny Mathes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Demetrius Thorny Mathes was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety at all times.  No alcohol or drugs of any kind.  Must notify agent within 24 hours of any new Rx.  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid D/L.  AODA and comply with all treatment and conditions as recommended by agent.  Must participate in all follow-up aftercare per agent.  Any counseling/treatment per agent.  Unpaid costs are to be converted to civil judgment.  Random UA's per agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
03:26 PM Defendant Demetrius Thorny Mathes in court with attorney Allison A Markoski.  Defendant Demetrius Thorny Mathes in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State received and reviewed the revocation packet.  No changes or additions.  Atty Markoski received same and raises credit.  Court notes there was a motion for resentencing filed.  Atty Markoski notes that the 92 days credit referenced are not available in this case as they were used in a Dane County case.  State makes recommendation.  Atty Markoski makes recommendation.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 2:

WI State Prison for 4 years (2 years Initial Confinement/2 years Extended Supervision) - FORTHWITH
616 days jail credit

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Absolute sobriety at all times
No alcohol or drugs of any kind
Must notify agent within 24 hours of any new Rx
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid D/L
AODA and comply with all treatment and conditions as recommended by agent
Must participate in all follow-up aftercare per agent
Any counseling/treatment per agent
Unpaid costs are to be converted to civil judgment
Random UA's per agent's discretion
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program

OF MOTION HEARING SEPTEMBER 10, 2021

re: resentencing

11:00 AM Defendant Demetrius Thorny Mathes in court with attorney Frances Reynolds Colbert.  Defendant Demetrius Thorny Mathes in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes motion filed for resentencing.  She has reviewed that and the case law cited therein.  Parties are read to proceed.  Court notes DE appeared by Zoom for the sentencing but the Court never questioned him re: his right to appear in person so she believes the DE is entitled to be resentenced.  Court vacates sentence imposed on 2/24/21.  Possibility of a different judge at resentencing is addressed.  Atty Colbert notes DE will need to have local counsel appointed for resentencing argument.  Court notes DE will now have to stay at Sauk Co Jail pending sentencing and is wondering if arrangments were made to have his belongings brought here with him from the prison he's being housed at.  Atty Colbert states that did not happen.  DE is currently housed at Dodge Correctional.  Court was ready to proceed today w/resentencing but as the parties are not ready to proceed.  DE will remain in custody at the Sauk Co Jail and will remain in custody pending resentencing.  Atty Colbert to contact PD's office re: new counsel being appointed.  Court asks that Atty Albrecht and appointed counsel touch base w/her JA to get this set as soon as they can.  DE states he only has hygiene items at Dodge and has his medications w/him here.  Court will find time on her calendar to get this on ASAP.  Atty Colbert states she will stop by the PD's office on her way out.

02:06 PM Defendant Demetrius Thorny Mathes in court, in custody.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes we are here to address a petition filed by DE re: waiver of fees/costs for copies.  Court questions DE on the portions the DE didn't fill out and just put "NA".  DE responds - states he has no assets.  Court will have a copy of the JOC provided to the DE and finds DE indigent for that purpose.  Court also notes the JOC from 2/4/2021 and the post-conviction form filled out in January 2019 and plea questionaire and JOC from then also.  List of documents that make up this file to be provided to the DE.  If/when the notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief goes through, they can utilize that document.  DE has requested the PD's office appoint an attorney for him and his appeal.  They would then have access to that record and all documents once that attorney is appointed.  DE has not heard anything from PD's office re: appointment of counsel.  Court asks COC's office to forward his notice of intent to the PD's office.  Court notes it looks like that has already been done.

Defendant Demetrius Thorny Mathes in court, in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises she received letter today from Mr. Gumz advising new counsel has not been appointed yet.  Any further requests for new counsel will result in forfeiture of right to have counsel.  Court will not allow continued last minute requests for new counsel.  New counsel to be appointed.  Court removes the jury trial from the court's calendar but schedules status conference for 8:30 a.m. on November 13, 2018, with new counsel and State to determine future motion hearing deadlines.  Status conference scheduled for November 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.
by Atty. Albrecht
allowing counsel to withdraw
Dane Co. jail
Motion hearing on November 1, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Demetrius Thorny Mathes in court with attorney Clifford C. Burdon.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Burdon states he talked to DE prior to court and DE is requesting Atty Burdon not be his counsel any more.  Court questions DE on his request and notes he has had several other attorneys in this case, Atty Burdon is the fifth attorney of record.  Court requests they go off the record to see if the PD's office will even appoint him new counsel unless he wants to represent himself.  Atty Burdon states he will call the PD's office.  Court takes recess.  Back on the record, Atty Burdon states he talked to Atty Mark Gumz and he stated that they will appoint him another attorney.  Atty Gumz was informed of the speedy trial demand and JT set for 11/13/2018.  Court notes several motions were set to be heard today and DE states he was aware of that.  Court informs DE of motions that were to be heard today must be heard before a JT can be held.  DE states he doesn't understand.  Court explains to DE that his request to dismiss Atty Burdon will negate his speedy trial demand.  DE agrees/understands and states he still wishes to dismiss Atty Burdon.  Court advises DE that since there was a $2,500 cash bond ordered on 7/5/2018 that has not been posted so he will go into custody today.  DE doesn't understand.  Court explains and directs he be taken into custody pending the posting of the $2,500.00 cash bond previously ordered.  Court addresses Ludwig hearing requested and explains what that is.  State states what the last offer was that the DE was given.  DE states he never rec'd offer.  Atty Burdon states he conveyed these offers to DE.  DE wants to consider offers.  Court notes motions still before the court.  Motions to be reset.  Off the record the court sets a new MH date.  MH hearing set and court will address speedy trial demand at that time once new counsel has been appointed.  Court orders DE taken to Sauk Co Jail until $2,500.00 cash bond previously ordered is posted.

OFFERS GIVEN ONLY:

Ct 1:  OWI 5/6
Cts 2 and 3:  Dismissed

Options:
A)  PSI - argued sentencing

B) 4 years prison (1 year initial confinement plus 3 years extended supervision)
$1819 and $100 fine/costs/surcharges
AODA/DNA sample
Revoke DL 36 months and IID for 36 months
Absolute sobriety, not to operate MV w/o valid DL and AODA and follow up

C)  Probation for 3 years
12 months jail w/huber 1st 48 hrs consecutive and consecutive to any other sentence/commitment
EMP approved
$1819 and $100 fine/costs/surcharges
AODA/DNA sample
Revoke DL 36 months and IID for 36 months
Absolute sobriety, not to operate MV w/o valid DL and AODA and follow up

Defendant Demetrius Thorny Mathes in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Det. Drew Bulin from SCSD.  State notes the motion only goes to the point of the stop so testimony would be brief.  Atty Varner agrees.  State calls Det. Drew Bulin - SCSD - S&T.  Atty Varner does cross-exam.  Atty Varner shows video.  Stops it at 3:18:04.  Witness excused w/o further questions.  State has no further witnesses.  Atty Varner has no witnesses but makes brief argument.  State makes brief argument.  Court views video again and takes recess to make decision.  Court notes video has been marked as an exhibit (from 3:16:18 to 3:18:04).  Court receives exhibit #1.  Court denies motion to suppress.  Matter will be set for trial.  Bond continued.
